nodes.text: A sauna was a room that consisted of a steam or heat filled room, wherein the pores could be cleansed, and a pool or hot tub. Despite this, it proved hazardous, and often fatal, to species other than humans because of the concentrated heat levels.

A sauna was aboard the MedStar-class frigate and used daily by Admiral Tarnese Bleyd. He kept the temperature of the sauna so excessively high, that entering it would blister the skin of most of the crew.
